meanings.definition: A system or arrangement of ranks or classes
meanings.sent1: In the school, the students were divided into different ordines based on their grades.
meanings.sent2: The military has a strict ordines where soldiers are ranked according to their experience.
meanings.sent3: At the animal shelter, the dogs formed their own ordines based on their favorite toys.
meanings.sent4: The ordines of flowers in the garden created a beautiful rainbow of colors.
meanings.sent5: The ordines of books on the shelf made it easy to find the one she was looking for.

meanings.definition: A group or body of people united for a common purpose
meanings.sent1: The volunteers formed an ordines to clean up the park together.
meanings.sent2: The political party members worked as an ordines to win the election.
meanings.sent3: The ordines of friends gathered to surprise him on his birthday.
meanings.sent4: The ordines of ants worked tirelessly to build their anthill.
meanings.sent5: The ordines of musicians played in perfect harmony during the concert.

meanings.definition: A sequence or series of things in a particular order
meanings.sent1: She followed the ordines of steps to bake a delicious cake.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained the ordines of events that led to the American Revolution.
meanings.sent3: The ordines of colors in the rainbow always fascinated the children.
meanings.sent4: The ordines of numbers on the clock showed it was time to go home.
meanings.sent5: The ordines of planets in the solar system amazed the young astronomer.
